@@ -1,1 +204,208 @@-- | The outer Maybe is Nothing if this function hasn't been computed before

getValues :: forall k v. IdeRule k v => Var Values -> k -> FilePath -> IO (Maybe (Maybe v))
getValues state key file = do

comments.body: What does the Maybe (Maybe v) mean? For example what does Just Nothing tell me?

Just Nothing tells you that it has been computed, but that last time it computed, it failed to produce a value. There's no point rerunning it because it has working dependencies, so it will fail again. In contrast, Nothing means it hasn't ever been computed.
